content.5: He that is ready to slip with
content.6: The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth
content.7: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:
content.8: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.
content.9: Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the
content.11: Doth not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?
content.14: Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.
content.15: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.
content.17: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.
content.18: He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.
content.19: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.
content.20: He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.
content.21: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.
content.22: He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.
content.23: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them
content.24: He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness
content.25: They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like
